MARCH 6, 2023
5:30 PM
SULLIVAN CHAMBER

~FINAL ACTIONS~
MEETING

Monday, March 6, 2023

TIME

5:30 PM

PRESIDING OFFICER

Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui

Arrived

5:44 PM

Mar 6, 2023

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the transfer of $325,000
in the General Fund between School Department statutory accounts as follows: $325,000 from the
Salary and Wages account to the School Travel and Training account ($205,000) and to the School
Extraordinary Expenditures account ($120,000). The transfer will be used to fund current and
anticipated workers’ compensation settlement costs related to School Department personnel injured in
the performance of their duties. The transfer will also be used to fund the purchase of a new electric
van for the Rindge School of Technical Arts (RSTA).
CMA 2023 #66
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

2. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of
transfer of $205,000 in the General Fund between School Department Other Ordinary Maintenance
account to the School Extraordinary Expenditures account. The transfer will fund the purchase of a
new electric vehicle for Facilities Maintenance; the installation of new garage doors at the King Open
School and CRLS; and to purchase a new CRLS Crew Sculling boat to replace a boat which is at the
end of its cycle.
CMA 2023 #67
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

3. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to Policy Order 2022 #181,
regarding convening a North Mass Avenue Corridor District Zoning Proposal Working Group.
CMA 2023 #68
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Nolan,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor McGovern


PAGE 2

Mar 6, 2023

4. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of
$150,000 from Free Cash to the Public Investment Fund Community Development Department
Extraordinary Expenditures account to be used for professional services for a planning study for
Massachusetts Avenue from Cambridge Common to Alewife Brook Parkway. Funds will be
combined with existing balances from prior related projects.
CMA 2023 #69
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [7-0-2]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons,
Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Azeem, Councillor McGovern

5. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of
$250,000 from Free Cash to the Public Investment Fund, Emergency Communications Extraordinary
Expenditures account. This appropriation will fund the replacement of critical infrastructure to
support the City of Cambridge radio system.
CMA 2023 #70
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Nolan,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor McGovern

6. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report Item
Number 22-78, regarding safety concerns at the LBJ Apartment building.
CMA 2023 #71
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

7. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to a transfer of $40,000
from the General Fund Reserves Other Ordinary Maintenance account to the General Fund City
Council Other Ordinary Maintenance account to cover current and anticipated costs related to the
work of the Charter Review Committee.
CMA 2023 #72
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 3

Mar 6, 2023

8. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the City of Cambridge
retaining its AAA rating from the nation's three major credit rating agencies.
CMA 2023 #73
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

9. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the Annual Surveillance
Report concerning City Departments’ use of Surveillance Technology or Surveillance Data.
CMA 2023 #74
RESULT:
REPORT ACCEPTED/APPROVED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 4

Mar 6, 2023

II. CALENDAR

CHARTER RIGHT
1. An application was received from Ender Saricay, requesting permission for a curb cut at the
premises numbered 112 Hampshire Street; said petition has received approval from Inspectional
Services, Traffic, Parking and Transportation, Historical Commission and Public Works. No
response has been received from the neighborhood association.
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR ZONDERVAN
IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 27, 2023
APP 2023 #10
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor
McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

2. That the joint Economic Development and University Relations and Neighborhood and LongTerm Planning, Public Facilities, Arts & Celebrations Committees forward the amended proposed
Policy Order regarding Labs and Neighborhood Planning to the full City Council.
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR ZONDERVAN
IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 27, 2023
POR 2023 #39
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Azeem, Councillor McGovern
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor
McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

3. That the City Manager is requested to direct the appropriate City Departments to work with
Eversource to include in their annual reporting, updates on their work to move forward with
providing the infrastructure required to move Cambridge toward electrifying the city.
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR NOLAN
IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 27, 2023
POR 2023 #40
Councillor McGovern, Councillor Toner, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Nolan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor
McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 5

Mar 6, 2023

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
4. An Ordinance has been received from Diane P. LeBlanc City Clerk, relative to Emissions
Accounting Zoning Petition (Ordinance #2022-20)
PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL DECEMBER 19, 2022
TO BE ORDAINED ON OR AFTER JANUARY 9, 2023
EXPIRES ON MARCH 6, 2023
ORDINANCE AMENDED IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 27, 2023
ORD 2022 # 20
RESULT:
ORDAINED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor
McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

5. An Ordinance has been received from Diane P. LeBlanc, relative to Ordinance # 2022-6 Article
III Green Jobs 2.66.100 Definitions.
PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 27, 2023
TO BE ORDAINED ON OR AFTER MARCH 20, 2023
ORD 2022 # 6
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

IV. RESOLUTIONS
1. Congratulations to Robert Steck on his retirement from the City of Cambridge.
Councillor Toner, Councillor Carlone and entire membership.
RES 2023 #72
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

2. That the City Council recognize March as National Social Workers Month.
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui and entire membership.
RES 2023 #73
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

3. Congratulations to Sam Corda on his retirement from the Cambridge Water Department.
Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Toner, Councillor McGovern, Councillor Simmons and entire
membership.
RES 2023 #74
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

PAGE 14

Mar 6, 2023

V. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. That the City Manager is requested to direct the appropriate City staff to explore the feasibility of
crafting a policy that will ensure that the City is notified whenever a high-rise building over six floors
experiences elevator failures.
POR 2023 #42
Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

2. That the City Manager is requested to work with the Department of Public Health and the Parks
Department to determine the feasibility of installing Automated External Defibrillators at all public
parks and practice fields, and any other public place as appropriate.
POR 2023 #43
Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Nolan, Councillor McGovern, Councillor Toner
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

3. That the City Manager be and is hereby requested to direct CDD to provide language that would
amend the Patrick Barrett et al. North Mass Ave BZ-5 Zoning District Petition to include the
amendments proposed by the petitioner and report back to the City Council by March 13, 2023.
POR 2023 #44
Councillor Zondervan, Vice Mayor Mallon
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

4. That the City Council go on record in support of the Tenant Protection Act HD.3922/SD.2368.
POR 2023 #45
Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

NAYS:
Councillor Toner


PAGE 15

Mar 6, 2023

5. That the City Manager is requested to work with relevant departments to assist BAY-CASH as they
begin working with unhoused youth in Cambridge.
POR 2023 #46
Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Zondervan, Councillor McGovern, Vice Mayor Mallon
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

6. That the City Manager is requested to confer with the City Manager’s Housing Liaison, Community
Development Department, Cambridge Housing Authority, and the City Solicitor on the feasibility of
municipally-funded housing vouchers.
POR 2023 #47
Mayor Siddiqui, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

7. That the City Manager is requested to fund the HEART initiative and negotiate a contract for services
with HEART, to include but not limited to HEART responding to certain 911 calls.
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR NOLAN
IN COUNCIL MARCH 6, 2023
POR 2023 #48
Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Azeem, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Nolan
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR NOLAN
Next: 3/20/2023 5:30 PM

8. That the City Manager is requested to confer with the appropriate City departments to ensure multifamily properties on the market are reviewed as quickly as possible as potential affordable housing
acquisitions.
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR SIMMONS
IN COUNCIL MARCH 6, 2023
POR 2023 #49
Councillor Nolan, Mayor Siddiqui, Vice Mayor Mallon
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR SIMMONS
Next: 3/20/2023 5:30 PM

Mar 6, 2023
